case_name: Kristine McGinn vs. Stephen Bleeker & Assurance Home Care Inc.
outcome_details: The court granted an injunction to preserve the status quo prior to the alleged unauthorized termination of Kristine McGinn, protecting her interests in Assurance Home Care Inc. pending arbitration.
decision_factors: The injunction sought was determined to be prohibitive in nature.
The RJR-MacDonald test was applied, considering the preservation of the status quo, irreparable harm, and the balance of convenience.
The court found the applicant would suffer irreparable harm without an injunction.
cited_cases: RJR-MacDonald Inc. v. Canada (Attorney General), 1994 CanLII 117 (SCC)
Boni v. Leonardo Worldwide Corporation, 2018 ONSC 1875
FDV Inc. v. 1338121 Ontario Ltd., 2011 ONSC 3816
International Steel Services Inc. v. Dynatec Madagascar SA, 2016 ONSC 2810
1323257 Ontario Ltd. (c.o.b. Hyundai of Thornhill) v. Hyundai Auto Canada Corp., 2009 CanLII 494 (ON SC)
summary: Kristine McGinn filed for an urgent injunction to prevent unauthorized removal from her roles at Assurance Home Care Inc. by Stephen Bleeker. The court decided on granting a prohibitive injunction, asserting that preserving the status quo will support the arbitration process to determine if the termination was rightful.
